document_data.name: That Which Lurks
document_data.mainbody:
'''That Which Lurks''' was a [[death knight]] sentry that guarded the entrance to the [[Murder Tribunal]] deep in the [[Undercellar]] of [[Baldur's Gate|Baldur's Gate's]] [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. {{Quote|''To passions brash thou art a slave.''
''This sinful ground shall be thy grave.''|That Which Guards}}
document_data.Description: That Which Lurks wore a set of intricately decorated [[plate mail]], [[gauntlets]], enchanted pair of ''[[blackguard's greaves]]'', and a horsetail [[helmet]]. The creature's armor was lines with [[gold]]. It carried a [[longsword]].
document_data.Abilities: That Which Lurks shared abilities and vulnerabilities of other [[undead]] creatures. It could land smiting cleaves that could stagger the targets.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, That Which Lurks was placed to stand guard of the entrance to the Murder Tribunal alongside [[That Which Guards]] and [[That Which Watches]]. The creature spoke in rhymes with an archaic turn of phrase.
